questions.question_text: Which virtualization feature is provided by network-attached storage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I believe it is A

Selected Answer: B
Im going with b..

all the other are functionalities that are provided by the hypervisor.

Selected Answer: BE
B and E for sure

Selected Answer: CE
I agree with PacketLife - public cloud and private cloud are not service models. And since IaaS is more involved, only SaaS and PaaS make sense

Selected Answer: BE
BE should be right

Selected Answer: BE
"a newly developed application" They developed the application.

Selected Answer: BE
B an E

comments.content:
because we are using public cloud..

and we will be using PaaS so we only manage the app.. not the infra or the OS! (but not consumig an app, like SaaS)

PaaS (E) - agreed. It should be one of the answers and no doubts there.
But, Public Cloud (A) may not be a choice as PaaS is one of the service models of Cloud Computing. (Refer to Figure 5-2, page number 271 of the CCNP and CCIE Data Center Official Cert Guide). 

IaaS may not fit the bill either, because that means we own certain responsibility to manage the OS and DB services.

So SaaS could be the other choice here? 

C & E seems to be more logical here.

Nevermind, I think B and E makes more sense.

PaaS is a part of Public Cloud. So we we are choosing Public Cloud and PaaS.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
Should be C & E

questions.question_text: An engineer must suggest deployment model for a newly developed application. The engineer has a small starting budget and lacks technical knowledge and infrastructure to implement storage, operating system, and database services to support the application deployment. The engineer also needs usage data related to the service and the ability to elastically scale the deployment as customer demands grow. Which two models must be used to meet the requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The answer is Correct 

UCS-A# scope security
UCS-A /security # create keyring kr220
UCS-A /security/keyring* # set modulus mod1024
UCS-A /security/keyring* # commit-buffer

UCS-A# scope system
UCS-A /system # scope services
UCS-A /system/services # enable https
UCS-A /system/services* # set https port 443
UCS-A /system/services* # set https keyring kring7984
UCS-A /system/services* # set https cipher-suite-mode high
UCS-A /system/services* # set https ssl-protocol tls1-2
UCS-A /system/services* # commit-buffer

questions.question_text:

An engineer must configure Cisco UCS Manager to accept only HTTPS connections that use TLS 1.2. The cipher security level must be high and the length of the keyring key value must be 2048 bits. Drag and drop the code snippets from the right onto the blanks in the code on the left to accomplish these goals. Not all commands are used.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
D. Cisco UCS PowerTool Suite is not supported on Linux as such B is not correct.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct!

questions.question_text:
A network administrator's creating a custom Django self-service portal that runs on a Linux server to automate the creation of new VLANS on Cisco UCS
Manager. Which feature must be installed and configures on the server?

An engineer must configure a backup and restore of Cisco UCS Manager during the weekend maintenance windows. The configuration must be restored to its original state on Monday morning. The end users can make changes only to the Service Profile configuration. Which set of actions meets these requirements?

choices.D: Schedule a logical backup to run at the start of every weekend and schedule the import of the backup to run on Monday morning.
choices.B: Schedule a logical backup to run at the star of every weekend and manually import the backup on Monday morning.
choices.C: Schedule a system backup to run at the start of every weekend and schedule the import of the backup to run on Monday morning.
choices.A: Schedule a system backup to run at the start of every weekend and manually import the backup on Monday morning.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
You cannot schedule an import operation.

Selected Answer: D
D. Schedule a logical backup to run at the start of every weekend and schedule the import of the backup to run on Monday morning. -> Becuse we can create Import of the Back in UCS

With a logical backup it is not possible to restore a configuration
It should be a system backup and restore should be done scheduled

Selected Answer: B
I agree with jecq

Selected Answer: B
should be B!

comments.content:
Agree with jecq. We can't schedule import operation. It should be done manually.
Answer B is correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Only logical configuration includes Service Profiles!

System configurationâ€”An XML file that includes all system configuration settings such as usernames, roles, and locales. You can use the file generated from this backup to import these configuration settings to the original fabric interconnect or to a different fabric interconnect. You cannot use this file for a system restore.

Logical configurationâ€”An XML file that includes all logical configuration settings such as service profiles, VLANs, VSANs, pools, and policies. You can use the file generated from this backup to import these configuration settings to the original fabric interconnect or to a different fabric interconnect. You cannot use this file for a system restore.
